main_question: What are some of the rights and privileges of a Canadian citizen?
question: What are some of the rights and privileges of a Canadian citizen?
possible_answers: A. The right to be a candidate
B. The right to vote in federal, provincial, and territorial elections
C. The right to enter, remain in, or leave Canada
explanatory_sentence: All of the above â€” Canadian citizens have rights and privileges including the right to vote and run for office, to enter and remain in Canada, to obtain a Canadian passport, and to receive protection from the government.
